intro: Rabdosia shikokiana var. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western Shikokiana Rabdosia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
